conclusion: Principles of shadow formation affect shadow size and position.
Objects are a cake, a sandal, a domino, and a fish; shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
Moving the light source backward decreases shadow size and shifts position.
Shadows become smaller and shift to a new position as the light source moves backward.
Shadow of the cake moves downward and to the right; shadow of the sandal moves downward and to the left; shadow of the domino moves downward; shadow of the fish moves downward and to the right.

Summarize shadow movements: cake's shadow moves downward and to the right; sandal's shadow moves downward and to the left; domino's shadow moves downward; fish's shadow moves downward and to the right.
Conclude that shadows change in size and position due to light source movement.
Final answer: cake's shadow moves downward and to the right; sandal's shadow moves downward and to the left; domino's shadow moves downward; fish's shadow moves downward and to the right.
